action.content:
You’re guiding me through Mapworld to reach an Escape Room. I don’t know what it looks like, but you have its image.

First, describe your image in this format and nothing else:
DESCRIPTION: your description of the image

Whenever I ask a question, answer based only on your image in this format and nothing else:
ANSWER: your answer
action.label: context

action.content:
DESCRIPTION: The image shows a room with light-colored walls and carpeted flooring. There is a wooden bookshelf filled with various toys and items. A window with curtains is on the right side, and there are more toys scattered on the floor.

ANSWER: The room has a wooden bookshelf on the left side, filled with toys and items. There are toys scattered on the floor, and a window with curtains is on the right side.
action.label: response

action.content:

Here is the description of what the Escape Room looks like:  description: the image shows a room with light-colored walls and carpeted flooring. there is a wooden bookshelf filled with various toys and items. a window with curtains is on the right side, and there are more toys scattered on the floor.

answer: the room has a wooden bookshelf on the left side, filled with toys and items. there are toys scattered on the floor, and a window with curtains is on the right side
At each step you will receive the image of your current room. Based on what you know of the Escape Room from my description and the image you see,

ESCAPE

Do not generate any additional text.
